title: 113_hr4173
content: The Act is titled the "Brownfield Redevelopment and Economic Development Innovative Financing Act of 2014." It establishes the Brownfield Redevelopment and Economic Development Innovative Financing Program. The Brownfield Redevelopment and Economic Development Innovative Financing program, established by the Secretary of Housing and Urban Development, guarantees repayment of loans for brownfield redevelopment and urban renewal projects. Eligibility requires submission of a master plan meeting specific requirements and certification from the Environmental Protection Agency. The government, agency, or project must submit a master plan meeting requirements, certification from the EPA for environmental remediation, and any other information required by the Secretary. Loans under the Program must be used for brownfield redevelopment projects, including site acquisition, remediation, and facility relocation. The Program supports brownfield redevelopment projects by providing loan guarantees for activities like site acquisition, remediation, facility relocation, and site preparation. Entities applying for the loan guarantee must not have caused contamination on the brownfield site to be redeveloped and can only have one outstanding loan guaranteed at a time. The Program supports brownfield redevelopment projects by providing loan guarantees for activities like site acquisition, remediation, and facility relocation. Entities applying for the loan guarantee must not have caused contamination on the brownfield site to be redeveloped and can only have one outstanding loan guaranteed at a time, with specific criteria for loan amounts, interest rates, and duration. The loan for brownfield redevelopment projects can range up to $150,000,000 with a negotiable interest rate and a repayment term of 20 to 30 years. Repayment of principal and interest is not required within 10 years, but must begin within 15 years. The master plan must detail the project to be funded by the loan guarantee. The master plan for a brownfield redevelopment project must describe the project, including activities, budget, and impact on economic development and environmental quality. It should demonstrate non-Federal funds commitment, long-term job creation, environmental remediation, and community impact. The project must include details on long-term job creation, environmental remediation of brownfield sites, economic and environmental impact on the community, affordable housing, reduction of vehicle congestion and emissions, integration of green technology, improvement in air quality, complete streets planning, transit-oriented development, and evidence of non-Federal investment commitments. The Secretary will establish selection criteria for local governments and redevelopment projects to receive loan guarantees under the Program. Existing BRAC redevelopment projects with Federal assistance commitments will be given favorable consideration. The full faith and credit of the United States is pledged to guarantee payments. The full faith and credit of the United States is pledged to guarantee payments for redevelopment projects with existing Federal grants or loans. The Federal Government will not be liable for environmental remediation under any laws due to a loan guarantee. The Secretary will process all requests for loan guarantees under this section. The Secretary will process all requests for loan guarantees under this section, requiring a viable repayment schedule and sufficient collateral. Applicants may use grants as collateral but are not required to pledge them. The Secretary may require collateral for loan guarantees under this section, with grants as an option for collateral. Congressional committees must be notified before final approval of any loan guarantee. Definitions include "BRAC redevelopment project" for sites designated by the Secretary of Defense. Definitions for the section include terms like "BRAC redevelopment project," "brownfield," "local redevelopment agency," and "remediation action plan." These definitions clarify the scope and purpose of projects related to base realignment and closure sites. The Secretary will issue regulations for the Program, and $100,000,000 is authorized for fiscal year 2015 for guaranteed loans under this section.
